So I've playing KSP for over a year now and have become aware through HOCgaming and The Solar Gamer's videos that you can pan the camera around while controlling your spaceship (and presumably in the VAB too). Can anyone tell me how to do this?

Note: I'm taking about being able to move the camera focus like you can in the SPH. (when you hold down RBM and drag the camera around)

PIRATE

Edited July 30, 2013 by PIRATEONTHERUN
Hold down the middle mouse button or wheel while panning.
Its been ninja'd but you can also use the shift for other things I've forgotten
What I'm talking about is not zooming the camera in the VAB but making it easier to look at large rockets where parts are very far from the middle of the VAB where the camera is centered.

Well, I'm not quite sure I understand what you're asking for so I'll throw a bunch of possiblities out hoping one will cover the question.

RMB-dragging works in the staging view as well as VAB/SPH.

Scroll wheel works to zoom in/out, as noted.

With stock key-binding, "v" switches between different camera modes. (Auto, Free, and Chase)

Again with stock key-binding, "c" toggles between craft view and IVA view for crewed vessels.

If none of those options are what you were looking for, the official KSP wiki has a full list of standard controls: http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Controls

-- Steve
